workflow.name: Generate WordPress blog posts with GPT-4O and Pixabay featured images via form
workflow.description:
This workflow automates the creation of a draft article for a blog
## Use Cases 
* Rapidly generate blog content from simple prompts. 
* Ensure content consistency and speed up time-to-publish. 
* Automatically source and attach relevant featured images. 
* Save your digital marketing team significant time. (Personalized touch based on your experience)

## Prerequisites/Requirements
* An **OpenAI** API Key (for GPT-4O).
* A **Pixabay** API Key (for image sourcing).
* A **WordPress** site URL and API credentials (username/password or application password).

## Customization Options
* Adjust the AI prompt in the **AI Content Generation** node to change the content tone and style.
* Modify the search query in the **Pixabay Query HTTP** node to influence the featured image selection.
* Change the reviewer email address in the final **Send Review Notification** node.

workflow.name: Final blog from url copy + pic

values.content:
=You are an expert copy editor. Keep every fact, detail, and paragraph. Change only 10‚Äì15% of the words to create a lightly rewritten version for SEO freshness. Never summarize or shorten the content. Keep all headings and structure intact. Output strict JSON as requested. At the end of the article, append this call-to-action paragraph (do not paraphrase it):

Injured in a car accident? Contact ............. for a free consultation today. Our experienced car accident lawyers are ready to help you get the justice and compensation you deserve.

=You are a content editor specializing in SEO-friendly news rewrites. Your Task: Rewrite the article text provided in the INPUT, adhering strictly to these rules: 1. **Preserve the entire meaning, facts, names, and numbers.** 2. **Only rephrase 10-15% of the words** by replacing words or short phrases with high-quality synonyms. Do NOT summarize or change the structure. 3. Ensure the language is natural, professional, and not obviously AI-generated. 4. Return clean HTML (no markdown), using H2/H3 tags for headings and paragraphs for body text. --- INPUT --- {{$node["Extract Article Title & Body"].json.mainArticleText}} --- END INPUT --- Return a JSON object EXACTLY like: { "title": "Rewritten article title", "body": "Generate the full article using only

tags for section titles and

tags for paragraphs. The first section must be titled

Incident Overview

. Do not use the words 'Intro', 'Introduction', or 'Subheading' as literal text. Use a structure like this:

Incident Overview

...

Police and Fire Response

...

", "imagePrompt": "A very concise, cinematic description (maximum 15 words) of the core visual subject of the news event." }

parameters.completionMessage: =The article {{ $json.title.rendered }} was correctly created as a draft on WordPress!

parameters.name: q

parameters.content:
## Topic Input
## AI Content Generation

Sends the topic to an LLM to generate the article's title, body (in Markdown), and meta description, and then structures the output for WordPress.

## Featured Image Handling

Searches for a license-free image, downloads the binary, and uploads the image file directly to WordPress's media library.

## WordPress Draft Creation

Creates the post draft, merges the image ID, and attaches the featured image to the new post using the WordPress API.

## Reviewer Notification

Notifies the designated reviewer (e.g., via email or Slack) that a new draft is ready. Includes a brief pause for WordPress indexing.

## How it works
This workflow automates the creation of a draft article for a blog. It begins when a user submits a blog topic (e.g., via a form or manual input). The topic is sent to an AI model (like LLM/OpenAI) to generate the full article title, structure, body, and meta description.

Next, the workflow searches **Pexels/Pixabay** for a relevant, license-free featured image, downloads it, and uploads it to **WordPress**.

Finally, it creates a draft post on WordPress, populating the title, body, meta description, and attaching the featured image. A notification (email/Slack) is then sent to the content team, ensuring the draft is ready for review.

## Setup steps
1.  **AI Service:** Configure the "LLM/Article Extractor" node (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic) with your API key.
2.  **Image Service:** Configure the "Pixabay/Pexels" nodes with your API key.
3.  **WordPress:** Connect the "Post on WordPress" and "Attach media" nodes using your WordPress credentials (URL and API/username/password).
4.  **Notification:** Configure the "Send email/Slack" node in the **User feedback** section with the necessary credentials to notify the content reviewer.

parameters.formTitle: Create a WordPress post with AI
parameters.formDescription: =Fill this form with the required information to create a draft post on WordPress
